item.summary: When a table is deleted, master sends multiple close messages to the region server

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: It appears that the master does not clear its return message queue after it sends the close message or it keeps finding the close request in some other data structure that is not getting cleared.

Here's a patch that fixes the problem. It also sneaks in a naming-only change of the methods on RegionManager for dealing with regions to close and regions that are closing.

As a side note, the problem listed in this issue is actually not the only thing that was wrong. When a region server was told to close a region, the region was never taken off of the to-close list, meaning that even if it was reopened for some reason, it would have been told to close again, ad nauseum. Nice catch, Jim.
This breaks a lot of stuff. Making it a blocker.

Reviewed patch. +1

TTMR failed on windows, but that just may be windows.

+1
